poem:
**Beyond the Pale**

I wrote a letter to Mike  
to prune the wild vines of his words,  
where assassins tiptoe,  
casting shadows on morning coffee.  
In those tangled syllables,  
voices we've lost try to surface,  
but I want him to hear  
the simple rhythm of decency,  
not the rustle of leaves  
where sorrow is a well-worn path.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
